intro: Sarcoglottis arrabidae, commonly known as the Arrabida orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its terrestrial growth habit and unique floral structure. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in racemose inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in woodland and scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
